Native American Museums at Academic Center
Gayle Manning visits Ranger High-Tech Academy
High School Students Teaching Spanish to Elementary Students

br.span: CLICK HERE to view a COVID-19 resource page which features updates from the District, student academic content, and information for staff.

Kindergarten registration for the 2020-2021 academic school year opens online Monday, April 27, 2020 at 6 a.m. and will close Friday, May 15, 2020. In order for your student to attend kindergarten, they must be five years old by September 30, 2020. For more information about the Early Childhood Learning Community Kindergarten program, CLICK HERE to view the registration brochure.
The North Ridgeville City Schools have a substitute issue on the March 17, 2020 ballot. CLICK HERE to read frequently asked questions about Issue 13.
CLICK HERE to watch the following video as Superintendent Roxann Ramsey-Caserio addresses the class of 2020.
CLICK HERE to read a message from Superintendent Roxann Ramsey-Caserio regarding Ohio Governor Mike DeWine's decision to have an extended closing period for schools.
The 6th Annual North Ridgeville City Schools Dodgeball Tournament has been rescheduled for April 24. CLICK HERE for more information.
CLICK HERE to read a letter from Superintendent Roxann Ramsey-Caserio regarding the steps the District is taking to ensure a safe learning environment.

div.span: Liberty and ECLC Earn State Board of Education Awards

br.span: The North Ridgeville City Schools are proud to announce that Liberty Elementary earned the Overall A Award and the Early Childhood Learning Community earned the Overall A and All A Award by the State Board of Education for the second-straight year. CLICK HERE to learn about the awards.

div.span: Substitute Teachers and Support Staff Needed

br.span: The North Ridgeville City Schools are in need of substitute teachers and substitute support staff. CLICK HERE to be directed to the Human Resources page to learn about the job opportunities.
The North Ridgeville Academic Center Community Gym is open to the public. CLICK HERE for more information about the hours of operation.
Bus schedules for the 2019-2020 school year are now available. CLICK HERE to be directed to the transportation page to view bus schedule times.

Transportation forms are now located on the transportation page on the district website. All students in grades K-2 are assigned busing. Students in grades 3-8 that live more than one and a half miles from the school they attend are also offered busing. CLICK HERE to be directed to the transportation page to view forms and read information about busing. Bus routes will be available during the first week of August.
